page.title: 11River Thames at Chertsey
page.content: The Thames is widely used for sporting activities. The area around the bridge contains camp and caravan sites, a boatyard and many riverside holiday bungalows. There is much fishing, boating and picnicing in the area. There are a lot of pubs near the river which attract young people by offering discos and music. Fishing competitions take place regularly , and catches include pike, gudgeon, eels, minnows and even trout. The river is traversed by Chertsey Bridge which is 200 years old and to celebrate the bicentenary there was a raft race and firework display recently. Upstream of the bridge is Chertsey Lock which has recently been renovated to include new moorings. Slightly further upstream the river is crossed by the M3 motorway.
